heaviest_rainfall.status: On 04 January 2025, a record rainfall of 36.8mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  4.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: The lengthiest precipitation event recorded spanned 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025, it was characterized by a peak rain intensity of 4.6mm per hour and a total rainfall of 36.8mm.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning activity recorded in a single day is 23, which occurred on 07 September 2025 (since our records began on 11 April 2025).

nearest_lightning.status: When lightning struck on 13 May 2025, its position was recorded at just 4.97 miles away, the closest on record.

storm.status: No stormy weather is anticipated.  The last big storm was recorded on 16 September 2025, lasting 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 3.7.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: At the moment, it is not a heatwaves.  This year has seen 6 heatwavess; typically, 1.9 heatwavess happen every year.

tropical.status: The most recent tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and this has only occurred 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is south-westerly (204°).  In the UK, a south-westerly wind often means mild and wet weather.

gusts.status: The top recorded wind gust is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1737 miles from 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 2.0°C).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 176 m) and light levels (up 3153 lux).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 1274 m) and light levels (up 9624 lux) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 176.3m lower than yesterday, 666.4m lower than the past week, 1273.9m lower than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 689m and a peak of 1098m, averaging 692.9m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.
cloud levels.summary: Low clouds are expected, possibly some fog or persistent clouds.

Today’s average dew point temperature is 1.5°C higher than yesterday, 4.8°C higher than the past week, 4.5°C higher than the past month.

The dew point temperatures yesterday fell between 11.5°C minimum and 16.0°C maximum, with an average of 16.2°C; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 11.4°C and 11.7°C.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; mild temperatures are expected. Also, the air will be thick and uncomfortable and winds will be practically absent. Drizzle or light rain possible, low clouds are expected, possibly some fog or persistent clouds, and moderate levels of sunlight will be present. Changeable conditions.
